intro: Oonopsis multicaulis, commonly known as the multibranched moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and dark green to reddish-brown stems. The plant produces small, delicate leaves that are often curved and have a distinctive, elongated shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. Oonopsis multicaulis plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
